title: Order with respect to which, pursuant to section 484(2)(b) of that Act, a draft
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 (Covid
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 (Covid 

Restrictions Support Scheme) (Percentage Adjustment) Order 2021.
text_norm: 1 order may cited tax consolidation act 1997 (covid restriction support scheme) (percentage adjustment) order 2021

title: Order with respect to which, pursuant to section 484(2)(b) of that Act, a draft
heading: In this Order, “Act of 1997” means the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order, “Act of 1997” means the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 

(No. 39 of 1997).
text_norm: 2 order act 1997 mean tax consolidation act 1997 (no 39 1997)

title: Order with respect to which, pursuant to section 484(2)(b) of that Act, a draft
heading: In respect of each full week comprised within a claim period and falling
text_raw:
3. 

In respect of each full week comprised within a claim period and falling 
within the period beginning on 21 December 2020 and ending on 10 January 
2021— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the percentage specified in subparagraph (i)(I) of section 
485(7)(a) of the Act of 1997 shall be 20 per cent, 

the percentage specified in subparagraph (i)(II) of section 
485(7)(a) of the Act of 1997 shall be 10 per cent, 

the percentage specified in subparagraph (ii)(I) of section 
485(7)(a) of the Act of 1997 shall be 20 per cent, and 

the percentage specified in subparagraph (ii)(II) of section 
485(7)(a) of the Act of 1997 shall be 10 per cent. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 March, 2021. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 12th March, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [104] 3

title: Order with respect to which, pursuant to section 484(2)(b) of that Act, a draft
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This Order provides for an increase in the levels of payment under the Covid 
Restrictions Support Scheme to 20% of average 2019 turnover up to €20,000 
and to 10% of turnover above that amount, subject to a maximum weekly limit 
of €5,000, for the three weeks beginning 21st and 28th December 2020 and 4th 
January 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [104]
